post.summary: Use the Authentication Code provided in the redirect along with your applications Client Id and         Client Secret to obtain an Access and Refresh Token for the user.                  Note: An authorization code can be used for up to 1 min after being issued.         Rate Limit: 3/second, 60/minute

parameters.name: Exchange_Authorization_Code_for_Access_Refresh_TokensBody
parameters.description: Use the Authentication Code provided in the redirect along with your applications Client Id and         Client Secret to obtain an Access and Refresh Token for the user.                  Note: An authorization code can be used for up to 1 min after being issued.         Rate Limit: 3/second, 60/minute

get.summary: The authorization code grant is used for server-side applications for which source code is not         exposed and for which the confidentiality of the applications Client Id and Client Secret can be         maintained. This is a redirection based flow and as such a redirection uri must be registered and         provided when authenticating. When access is requested via this flow the user is directed to         a login page where they must authenticate and grant access to the server-side application. Once access has been         granted they will be redirected to the Redirect URI with an Authentication Code in the url args.         i.e. https://integrate.versature.com/docs/?code=Vb6YKAvTt6VYycU2DcML8Hmrsm4V4t This Authentication Code can be         used with the: Redirect URI, Client Id, and Client Secret to obtain an Access and Refresh Token.                           Before you begin you must obtain a Client Id and Secret: Developer Portal.                  Once you have provided your redirect uri to us and have obtained your Client Id and Client Secret; direct the         authenticating user to: https://integrate.versature.com/api/oauth/authorize/ be sure to         include the required arguments with your request (See below for arguments).                           Rate Limit: 3/second, 60/minute

parameters.name: response_type
parameters.description: The type of grant being performed

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: The redirect URI used to authenticate this user.

parameters.name: client_id
parameters.description: The id of the client. The unique identifier for your application

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Recommended - A value used by the client to maintain state between the request and the callback. Used to help prevent cross-site request forgery.

get.summary: Get the call records for a given time period for the user specified. The user (extension) will be used to get the call records for that user. Rate Limit: 5/second, 15/minute

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user/extension to retrieve the call records for. i.e. 101

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Get calls which started after this time.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Get calls which ended after this time.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from the beginning of the date/time period.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned. Max value 1000.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type and version which is acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value. Generally "Bearer ACCESSTOKEN"

get.summary: Get the call records for a given time period for the users specified. If provided the id will be used to get the call records for that user. If not specified call records will be fetched for the currently authenticated user. If you wish to retrieve all calls across your domain use the "all" argument. Rate Limit: 5/second, 15/minute

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The user/extension to retrieve the call records for. i.e. 101

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Get call records for all users?

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Get calls which started after this time.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Get calls which ended after this time.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from the beginning of the date/time period.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned. Max value 1000.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type and version which is acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value. Generally "Bearer ACCESSTOKEN"

get.summary: Get the call records for a given time period for the users specified. If provided the id will be used to get the call records for that user. If not specified call records will be fetched for the currently authenticated user. If you wish to retrieve all calls across your domain use the "all" argument. Rate Limit: 5/second, 30/minute

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The user/extension to retrieve the call records for. i.e. 101

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: The user to retrieve the call records for.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of calls to extract. Will provide all types if no value is specified.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Get calls from this time forward.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Get calls up to this time.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The offset from the beginning of the date/time period.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results to be returned. Max value 200.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type and version which is acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value. Generally "Bearer ACCESSTOKEN"

get.summary: Get the call records for a given time period for the users in a domain.     Rate Limit: 5/second, 15/minute

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Get calls which started after this time. In UTC if timezone not specified.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Get calls which ended after this time. In UTC if timezone not specified. If no start date is provided resutls for calls after this end date will be returned.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type of phone call which took place.

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The cursor/index from which to continue a previous request from

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of results to return at once. Maximum is 1,000

parameters.name: recording_available
parameters.description: filter cdrs to only include ones with recordings

parameters.name: min_duration
parameters.description: filter cdrs by minimum  duration

parameters.name: max_duration
parameters.description: filter cdrs by maximum  duration

parameters.name: phone_number
parameters.description: filter cdrs by phone number used

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The media type and version which is acceptable for the response.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization value. Generally "Bearer ACCESSTOKEN"

id.description: The phone number or sip address associated to this endpoint. Phone numbers will be in E164 notation.

user.description: The user associated with this call

call_id.description: Identifier for the origination/destination side of the call

duration.description: How many seconds the call lasted.

end_time.description: When the call ended apiSuccess {String="Inbound","Outbound","Missed", "Ext to Ext"} type The type of calls to extract. Will provide all types if no value is specified.

mode.description: The status of the agent to be set when signing out of a queue.

id.description: The id of the call which will be answered.

to.description: The device where the answered call should go.

state.description: Current state of the call. Progressing, Ringing, Active, Ended.

id.description: The phone number associated to this endpoint. Phone numbers will be in E164 notation.

user.description: The user associated with this call

state.description: Current state of the call. Progressing, Ringing, Active, Ended.

id.description: The phone number associated to this endpoint. Phone numbers will be in E164 notation.

user.description: The user associated with this call

to.description: The destination for this call. (Phone number, sip address)

from.description: Where this call originates. Will default to current authenticated user if a value is not provided.

auto_answer.description: Auto Answer - Should this caller side be auto answered. (May not be supported by the answering device.)

id.description: The id of the call which will be answered.
The phone number or sip address associated to this endpoint. Phone numbers will be in E164 notation.

user.description: The user associated with this call

call_id.description: Identifier for the origination/destination side of the call

duration.description: How many seconds the call lasted.

end_time.description: When the call ended apiSuccess {String="Inbound","Outbound","Missed", "Ext to Ext"} type The type of calls to extract. Will provide all types if no value is specified.

status.description: The current status of the recording.

url.description: A url to access the recording.

call_type.description: Indicates if this was and incoming, outgoing, or an internal call.

recording_status.description: The current status of the recording.

recording_url.description: A url to access the recording.

post_uri.description: The endpoint which is notified when an event occurs.

expires_in.description: The number of seconds until the subscription expires. Max value is 604800

user.description: One or more users to subscribe to. Omit to subscribe to all users. Append multiple times to subscribe to multiple users.

status.description: The current status of the recording.

url.description: A url to access the recording.
